q1.question: Robotics and automation engineer in Silesia — who is Michał Rapała?
q1.answer: A graduate of the Silesian University of Technology with over a decade of experience in engineering, robotics, and industrial automation. I live and work in Silesia, specializing in production process simulations, industrial robot programming, and building modern web applications.

q2.question: What is your experience in engineering, robotics, and IT?
q2.answer: I have over 10 years of professional experience. I specialize in industrial engineering, robotics and automation, as well as the automotive industry. In parallel, I develop websites, mobile applications, and implement solutions based on Artificial Intelligence (AI).

q3.question: What was your most demanding project in the automotive industry?
q3.answer: My key achievement is automating the body-in-white (BIW) production process for the Mercedes G-Class at the factory in Graz. It was an engineering challenge because this legendary model had been hand-built for the last 40 years. Implementing robotics and automation into this process was a milestone for the production line.

q4.question: Web applications and websites for businesses — Silesia and all of Poland
q4.answer: Building web applications and websites for businesses with special focus on the Silesian market. From company landing pages to advanced business tools — every project built with a modern stack (Next.js, React) with emphasis on performance and scalability.

q5.question: Do you optimize websites for SEO?
q5.answer: Yes, and this section is a perfect example. It's technically tailored for Google bots, even though I personally don't enjoy talking about myself — I prefer to let my completed projects speak for me.

q6.question: What programming technologies do you use in your projects?
q6.answer: My tech stack focuses on modern, high-performance solutions. For websites and applications, I primarily use React and Next.js. For mobile apps, I work with Flutter. I'm also actively interested in implementing AI in code and process automation.

q7.question: How do you use artificial intelligence (AI) in your projects?
q7.answer: AI is both a passion and a work tool. I use artificial intelligence in engineering projects (production process optimization) and in application development — e.g., Karton-na-leki, a mobile app for managing a home medicine cabinet with image recognition.
